resources: Which one of the following results in a decrease in total consumer expenditure? "If an economy moves from producing 10 units of Good X and 5 units of Good Y to producing 8 units of Good X and 6 units of Good Y, the opportunity cost of the 6th unit of Good Y is:" Which one of the following will NOT shift the supply curve for Good X to the right? "Good X has a price elasticity of demand equal to –1.5. In such circumstances, a per unit sales tax on Good X of £5 will lead to which of the following?" "Good Y has a cross elasticity of demand with respect to Good X calculated using the average method of –1. Initially 100 units of Good Y are demanded when Good X costs 20 pence. A rise in the price of Good X to 25 pence will result in a new level of demand for Good Y of:" "Making your selection from options A–D below, which of the following statements is NOT correct in relation to the Austrian school of thought? Economists following the Austrian school of thought: (i) place emphasis on individual subjective preferences. (ii) focus on market forces determining prices. (iii) believe in a centrally planned economic system." Which one of the following is TRUE? "A profit maximising monopoly facing a linear demand schedule and having positive marginal costs will set its price in the region of the demand curve where the absolute price elasticity of demand is:" Which one of the following statements about market structure is FALSE? Which one of the following is NOT a feature of perfect competition? "A managing director of a monopoly firm with constant marginal costs has the following data: Average revenue = £15 Marginal revenue = £10 Marginal cost = £11 Average variable cost = £11 Average total cost = £13 To maximise profits/minimise losses in the short run the firm should:" "If the price of Good X has risen and the quantity sold has increased, then there must have been a:" "A firm with fixed costs of £400 per week and constant average variable costs of £8 per unit of output, has the following information about its weekly sales: Which of the following levels of output yields the highest profit?" To calculate Gross National Income, you need to know all of the following EXCEPT: "In a simple closed economy with no government sector the consumption function relating consumption expenditure (C) to income (Y) is given by the expression: C = £40 million + 0.7 Y Planned investment is constant at £50 million. Which one of the following is TRUE?" "If the money supply increases due to an expansionary open market operation by the central bank, then the price of treasury bills will:" "Which of the following are the correct responses for the missing words (i) and (ii) in the following statement? Automatic stabilisers act to (i) ________ government expenditures and (ii)________ government revenues during a recessionary period." "The following data is available on an economy: Consumption Expenditure £70 million Investment £20 million Government Expenditure £40 million Exports £20 million Imports £30 million Net Income from abroad £10 million What is the value of its Gross National Income?" "An economy with a floating exchange rate has a large deficit on the current account of its balance of payments. Which policy combination would be most likely to reduce this deficit?" The narrow money supply (monetary base) is increased when: "Which one of the following is NOT likely to happen following a devaluation of the domestic currency on the foreign exchange market?" "Which one of the following would NOT constitute a demand side economic policy for reducing unemployment?" Which of the following will increase the size of the multiplier? "If an increase in the level of the money supply results in no change in either the nominal or real value of national income, then which of the following is TRUE?" One way of reducing the natural rate of unemployment would be to increase: "If the central bank has to intervene in the foreign exchange market to prevent the home currency from depreciating, then its foreign exchange reserves will:"
